sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "
 
There are 135 members on a student council in a school and the ratio of the number of boys to the number of girls is \(8 : 7 \). How many more girls should be added to the council so that the ratio of number of boys to the girls become \(8 : 9 \).
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "$$\text{Sum of the terms of the ratio is $ = \input[s1v1]{} + 7 = 15 $}$$"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "$$\text{So, number of boys in the council is}$$ 
\[
	= \frac{\input[s2v1]{} }{15 } \times 135 = 72.0 
\] "}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "$$\text{So, the number of girls in the council is}$$
\[
	= \frac{\input[s3v1]{} }{15 } \times 135 = 63.0 
\]"}, {"id": "s4", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "$$\text{Let $x$ be the number of girls that should be added to the student council. Now, number of girls is $ = \input[s4v1]{} + x $}$$"}, {"id": "s5", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "$$\text{So, according to given information, we can write that}$$
\[
	\frac{\input[s5v1]{} }{63.0 + x } = \frac{8 }{9 }
\]"}, {"id": "s6", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "\[\Rightarrow 648.0 = \input[s6v1]{} + 8 x\]"}, {"id": "s7", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "\[
	\Rightarrow \input[s7v1]{} = 8 x
\]"}, {"id": "s8", "n_params": 1, "step_txt": "\[
	\Rightarrow x = \input[s8v1]{} 
\]
$$\text{This is the number of girls that needs to be added.}$$"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": [8], "text": "$$\text{Sum of the terms of the ratio is the sum of the two parts of the ratio, which is 8 + 7 = 15.}$$"}, {"data": [8], "text": "$$\text{We know that the ratio of boys to girls in the council is $8 : 7$.Therefore, the fraction of boys in the council is $8 / (8 + 7)$.}$$"}, {"data": [7], "text": "$$\text{The ratio of boys to girls in the council is $8 : 7$.Similarly, the fraction of girls in the council is $7 / (8 + 7)$.}$$"}, {"data": [63.0], "text": "$$\text{After adding $x$ girls, the total number of girls in the council will be $63.0 + x$.}$$"}, {"data": [72.0], "text": "$$\text{According to the problem, the ratio of boys to girls in the council will remain the same after adding $x$ girls. Therefore, we can set up an equation $
	\frac{72.0 }{63.0 + x } = \frac{8 }{9 } $,using the ratios before and after adding $x$ girls.}$$"}, {"data": [504.0], "text": "$$\text{Cross-multiplying the fractions and simplifying, we get $648.0 = 504.0 + 8 x $ }$$ "}, {"data": [144.0], "text": "$$\text{Simplifying the equation, we get $144.0 = 8 x $}$$ "}, {"data": [18], "text": "$$\text{Upon further simplification we get the value of $x$, which is 18}$$"}]
